posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Hello All,

Unlike most threads in this Modules sub-forum, this is not yet a recommendation. It's a mod I've been aware of for some time, but only ventured into three times - never yet completing it (entirely down to me - the mod itself seems fine). But I'm now committed to finishing it.

Regardless, I believe it deserves a thread of its own, if for no other reason that it's probably the only one that will take your character right through to level 40 - even the mighty Aielund Saga can only manage around level 37.

Sands of Fate (SoF) consists of 3 mods - readily available from the NwN Vault - "Shadows over Heliopolis", "Gem Tower" and "Pyramid of the Ancients". They are all for epic characters, post HotU ideally. The first takes you up to cL30 and is set in "an alien land of baking deserts and strange foes". Your character from the end of HotU will be imported (with gear and loot), or you can create a L25 character to start it with. The blurb tells me that it's medium RP and Tricks/Traps, with Heavy Hack'n'Slash.

The second part, which sees you  returned to "a desert land after a dormant force of evil", gets you to about L35.

And the third apparently allows a significant amount of level 40 play, wherein you venture to "the pyramid whose pharaoh saved the land a 1000 years ago".

My understanding is that it is better for Good-aligned players, but the Vault leaves it open. I know Empyre and Valerfor have gone through the mods, and hope for some of their insights here - else it will end up being me running around as a headless chicken, clucking "What now? What now?" (except there is a walkthrough apparently as part of the download - so don't expect one here).

Of course, if it's a crap idea for a thread, it'll soon sink.

Cheers, y'all

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content:
You could start SoF at Normal skill level, and then change it to what you want when you arrive in Heliopolis.

The Pretty Good Char Creator is a module that runs in NWN.

Whatever route you take to SoF, if you plan to use armor, shield, and/or helmet, make sure you have some hefty protection from fire damage, or you will bake in the hot desert sun (fire damage). You only have to worry about that in chapter 1. That's why I am usually either an RDD or a DEX-er in SoF. Also, a weapon that does acid damage is very useful (desert folk), and later, you will benefit from a ranged weapon with either cold or fire damage (green slime).

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Have finally entered Sands of Fate, despite assorted (self-constructed, I'm sure) obstacles that made me think the gods didn't want me there. I hope it's worth the trouble!

I've arrived on the outskirts of Heliopolis, but be aware, when loading you will have to be fairly firm with the spirit that guards the planar gate to that city, or you'll just be wandering about aimlessly forever (you should be starting at a minimum of level 25, and, as Empyre has informed us elsewhere, be prepared to be a relatively good dude - sorry, Mick, have another absinthe). Please also be aware that you will (unless you've countered for it) be suffering heatstroke (fire damage), particularly if you're wearing a kettle, so some fire resistance or stripping is called for (again, I've taken a leaf from Empyre's book of knowledge and am intrisically fire-retardant as a level 10 RDD).

Another thing to bear in mind is that you'll be stripped of any bagged/inventoried gear and gold if you enter at Hardcore difficulty, and you'll likely have spent some time accumulating what you want. To avoid this, drop the difficulty rating down a notch or two, which allows full inventory import, then up it again once you've arrived. Something of a cheat, but not a grave one, I think.

I'm starting out with a highly bastardized version of Tyr Templar's Dragonborn Ranger (Ranger 26/ Bard 4/ RDD 10), and am currently at level 28 (Rgr 16/ B 2/ RDD 10), having done the OC and HotU solo (you'll probably be at 26/27 if you travelled with a companion). One could argue that this thread - proper - starts here. Apologies for previous ramblings.

I hope it's helpful
